Description: Jupiter, naked except for cloak over left shoulder, standing front, head left, holding vertical sceptre in left hand and thunderbolt in right hand above eagle, on ground, left, head turned back right: star in field, to right. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Bibliographic references: PCR / Principal coins of the Romans: Volume I: The Republic c. 290 - 31 BC; Volume II: The Principate 31 BC - AD 296; Volume III: The Dominate AD 294 - 498. (1216)
RIC6 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 6: from Diocletian's reform (AD 294) to the death of Maximinus (AD 313) (4, p.660) (type)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015-2016 29 Oct–7 Feb, London, BM, G35, Egypt: faith after the pharaohs.
